item.title: Covid: Government clarifies advice for areas in England worst-hit by Indian variant
item.description: "We are not imposing local restrictions," it says after confusion over new guidance on travel.

item.title: Covid: Dominic Cummings to be quizzed by MPs on pandemic handling
item.description: A joint committee of MPs will question the prime minister's former adviser on lessons to be learnt.

item.title: Covid vaccine: 30 and 31-year-olds in England now invited
item.description: Rollout continues, with anyone in their 30s now able to get vaccinated in England.

item.title: Building projects hit by lack of supplies and price rises
item.description: Industry warns people to delay home improvement due to shortage of cement, electric components, timber and steel.

item.title: Millions cannot afford water bills, says watchdog
item.description: Overhauling water tariffs could help struggling families, the Consumer Council for Water says.

item.title: Mast Upgrade: UK experiment could sweep aside fusion hurdle
item.description: Results from a UK experiment could help clear a hurdle to achieving commercial fusion power.

item.title: Three arrested in Corby after boy, 16, dies in stabbing
item.description: The teenager died at the scene despite the best efforts of paramedics, say police.

item.title: AI emotion-detection software tested on Uyghurs
item.description: A software engineer tells BBC's Panorama about installing the system in police stations in Xinjiang.

item.title: China overtakes Germany as UK’s top import market
item.description: It came as Brexit disrupted trade with the EU and the pandemic boosted demand for Chinese goods.

item.title: Carey Mulligan criticises government delay to charity aid
item.description: The government had agreed to pay to pay War Child £500,000 but has since delayed the funding.

item.title: George Floyd sister says Biden broke promise on bill
item.description: The murdered Minneapolis man's family express hope and frustration over stalled police reform legislation.

item.title: Housing: Shelter calls for 90,000 social homes to be built
item.description: The housing charity says around a third of British adults do not have safe or secure accommodation.

item.title: Families in anguish over pair held in Belarus
item.description: Roman Protasevich and his girlfriend Sofia Sapega were detained after a plane was diverted to Minsk.

item.title: The Papers: Lockdown 'farce' as vaccines 'hit new high'
item.description: The front pages look at updated travel advice for parts of England worst-hit by the Indian variant.

item.title: From protests to 'patriots': Why China is crushing Hong Kong dissent
item.description: After clamping down on protests it has reformed elections - what does this mean for Hong Kong's future?

item.title: Dominic Cummings: His views on Covid and why it matters
item.description: Boris Johnson's former chief adviser has been a critic of the government since leaving his role.

item.title: In pictures: Prince William and Kate visit Scotland
item.description: The Earl and Countess of Strathearn are attending a series of events during their trip north of the border.

item.title: 'I thought I was too old to be on TikTok'
item.description: Spencer West has garnered legions of fans sharing his perspective as a disability advocate.

item.title: Sri Lanka navy rescue crew following chemical fire on cargo ship
item.description: All 23 members of the Singaporean X-Press Pearl's crew were evacuated.

item.title: John Cena: Fast and Furious star sorry over Taiwan remark backlash
item.description: John Cena posts a video apology in Chinese after describing Taiwan as a "country".

item.title: Cummings testimony: What is herd immunity?
item.description: Herd immunity is a scientific term, so why is there a row about it?

item.title: Amateur choirs 'devastated' at Covid rule change in England
item.description: Hundreds of choirs have had to cancel rehearsals after the government said singing poses a health risk.

item.title: Jerusalem's Sheikh Jarrah: The land dispute in the eye of a storm
item.description: Moves to evict Palestinians in a Jerusalem district helped ignite the recent Israel-Gaza conflict.

item.title: Letter from Africa: Why Queen of England has a throne in Nigeria
item.description: A myth among the Efik people is that one of their 19th Century kings married Queen Victoria.

item.title: Covid: 'The horror of laying everyone off made me sick'
item.description: Company bosses and managers talk about the impact of the pandemic on their mental health.

item.title: The key squad issues facing England manager Southgate
item.description: The key issues still to be settled after England manager Gareth Southgate announced his provisional squad for Euro 2020.

item.title: Uefa opens proceedings against Barcelona, Juventus & Real Madrid
item.description: Uefa opens disciplinary proceedings against Barcelona, Juventus and Real Madrid over their involvement in the proposed European Super League.

item.title: England Test and Royal Ascot to be next fan pilot events
item.description: An England cricket Test match and horse racing's Royal Ascot to be among the next pilot events to test the return of big crowds to sports venues.

item.title: Bernal prepares for intense final week at Giro after fans chase him with chainsaws
item.description: Back in form after a 2020 ruined by injury, can anyone deny 2019 Tour de France champion Egan Bernal victory in the final week at the Giro d'Italia?

item.title: Lawro's predictions: Villarreal v Man Utd - Europa League final special with Tom Grennan
item.description: BBC football expert Mark Lawrenson takes on singer Tom Grennan to predict whether Manchester United or Villarreal will win the Europa League final.

item.title: Galtier leaves French champions Lille two days after winning title
item.description: Head coach Christophe Galtier steps down from Lille just two days after they won the French league title.

item.title: UK holidays: When and where can I go.... and who with?
item.description: The rules on having a holiday in the UK have been relaxed - but restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid Indian variant: Where is it, how does it spread and is it more infectious?
item.description: The Indian variant is spreading in some parts of the country - how serious is it?

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: People in their 20s and 30s are now being offered a Covid vaccine as the UK rollout continues.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: Foreign holidays are now possible, but travellers must follow strict rules on their return.

item.title: What are the rules for weddings and can I hold a reception?
item.description: Restrictions on weddings have been eased across the UK - so how can you now celebrate?

item.title: Children tell of neglect, filth and fear in US asylum camps
item.description: The BBC has uncovered allegations of cold temperatures, sickness, lice and abuse, through a series of interviews with children and staff at US detention camps for children.

item.title: Martin Bashir inquiry: Diana, the reporter and the BBC
item.description: The full story of how the BBC's Martin Bashir got his 1995 interview with Princess Diana - and what happened next.

item.title: The black children wrongly sent to 'special' schools in the 1970s
item.description: In the '60s and '70s, black children were wrongly sent to schools for the "educationally subnormal".

item.title: Uyghur imams targeted in China's Xinjiang crackdown
item.description: China has targeted Muslim religious leaders, according to a new report, charging many with extremism.

item.title: 'Talk to me': A train driver asking men to open up
item.description: A tragedy inspired Scotland's only woman freight train driver to get men talking about mental health.
